list.name: Battery Quality
list.description: How long does the battery of a <replacer>-phone remain reliable? Is the battery easily replaceable?

list.name: Durability
list.description: How long can the <replacer>-phone remain functional and relevant? How resistant is it to physical damage?

list.name: Planned Obsolescence
list.description: Does the <replacer> Company employ strategies, such as performance-reducing software updates, to encourage users to replace their phones within a few years?

list.name: Ease of Repair
list.description: How easy is it for the end user to repair the <replacer>-phone?

list.name: Ease of Modification
list.description: Can the <replacer>-phone's performance be upgraded by the user?

list.name: Raw Materials Origin
list.description: Where are the natural resources used in the <replacer> smartphone production coming from? Specifically, where are the mines located for rare earth elements used in metal extraction?

list.name: Transportation
list.description: What are the distances involved, not only between production sites, but also to the final point of distribution of <replacer>-Smartphones?

list.name: Manufactoring
list.description: What processes are used to transform raw resources into consumer electronics? This includes intermediate products, such as printed circuit boards, and the assembly of the final smartphone. How does the <replacer>-Company act to improve those, from a sustainable point of view?

list.name: Recycled Parts
list.description: To what extent are the parts of a <replacer>-phone recycled?

list.name: Sustainable Innovativity
list.description: What does the manufacturer of the <replacer>-phone do for the environment? Does the <replacer>-phone has unique innovations in terms of enabling increased sustainability?
